info.game_comments:
Seth Wilson game 12.

WE ASKED: Matthew Weiner.

double_jeopardy_round: I SEE WHAT YOU DID THERE
BEST PICTURE OSCAR WINNERS BY SETTING

(1, 1).clue: This state's flag is easily flown upside down by mistake; it's even happened over the Capitol in Nashville

(2, 1).clue: 2-word alliterative term for the moment after a play when actors return to receive applause

(3, 1).clue: Music symbol term following bass or treble

(4, 1).clue: Per their system of numerals, ancient Romans kept it this letter

(5, 1).clue: These 2 title MTV cartoon guys thought the band Kiss was "pretty cool for a bunch of mimes"

(6, 1).clue: On the boat out to the island, I sipped champagne, both doux ("sweet") & sec (this opposite quality)

(1, 2).clue: Many nations adopted this country's tricolored design

(2, 2).clue: In the expression "Bad dress-- good show", "dress" is short for this

(3, 2).clue: A place of protection or shelter, say from the storm

(4, 2).clue: "You miss 100% of the shots you don't take" is attributed to this NHL legend known as "The Great One"

(5, 2).clue: From 1970 to 2011 "All My Children" sizzled with Susan Lucci as this character

(6, 2).clue: Next to where the helicopters were parked, I tasted a great white varietal fittingly called "Chenin" this

(1, 3).clue: The stars & squares belong to this country that the U.S. helped become independent from Colombia

(2, 3).clue: This area farthest from the audience is where an actor goes to take the attention away from others

(3, 3).clue: In math it's the 9 in the expression 9x

(4, 3).clue: Search for it on the internet-- it's the term for 1 followed by 100 zeroes

(5, 3).clue: (I'm Mad Men creator Matthew Weiner.) I said this character I created "likes winning strangers over. He likes seducing strangers, and that's what advertising is"

(6, 3).clue: After hearing my bawdy joke, my wife did this, also a synonym for the rosé she was drinking

(1, 4).clue: The stars on New Zealand's flag represent this constellation

(2, 4).clue: The 3 elements of drama according to German theater critic Gustav Freytag: rising action, this, falling action

(3, 4).clue: Extremely villainous or wicked, like a type of scheme

(4, 4).clue: His 100th Top 40 hit was 1973's "Steamroller Blues", taken from his TV special "Aloha from Hawaii"

(5, 4).clue: Hey, Edith! This actor played Archie Bunker for 13 years

(6, 4).clue: I'd always called this red wine syrah, but the guy who was pouring said it's also called this

(1, 5).clue: The shield on this nation's flag was added in 1992 to make it different from the Russian tricolor flag

(2, 5).clue: This 2-word Latin term is used to denote the cast of characters in a play

(3, 5).clue: It sounds like it means rich, but it means flowing out

(4, 5).clue: In the 19th century this ancient Hellenistic monetary unit became equal to 100 lepta

(5, 5).clue: This was the full name of Henry Winkler's cool character on "Happy Days"

(6, 5).clue: The band played "The Longest Time" & I drank some Maestro, a blend made for this epic winemaker's 50th anniversary

(1, 1).clue: The return in 1660 of the monarchy & King Charles II isn't called the Reinstallation or the Redemption but this

(2, 1).clue: A trick the desert plays on your eyes, or a French fighter jet

(4, 1).clue: It's the word for someone from Copenhagen

(5, 1).clue: Emma Lazarus' poem "The New Colossus" is inscribed on the pedestal of this landmark

(6, 1).clue: Lighter-than-air gases include helium & this combustible one unfortunately used in the Hindenburg

(1, 2).clue: In 1833 the royal navy threw Argentina out of this island group; they did it again 149 years later

(2, 2).clue: The feather covering on birds; it has a more drab type that appears on the young to camouflage them

(3, 2).correct response: One Flew Over the Cuckoo\'s Nest

(5, 2).clue: The story of Jesus raising Lazarus from the dead is only found in this last New Testament gospel

(6, 2).clue: The myth of this unique bird rising from the ashes of its own funeral pyre dates back to ancient Egypt

(1, 3).clue: In December 1947 Parliament passed the law granting independence to this Asian island

(2, 3).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew demonstrates.)  What appears to be a simple bowl of water is actually filled with polymer-based jelly marbles that seem to disappear because they have the same index of this light-bending quality as the water

(3, 3).clue: The court of Emperor Josef II

(4, 3).clue: Pardner, it's a term for the center or core of something

(5, 3).clue: Taking place on a world where the planet is almost all water, "The Lazarus Effect" is a novel by this "Dune" author

(6, 3).clue: The Order of the Rising Sun is awarded by this country for exceptional civil or military merit

(1, 4).clue: Perhaps referring to the White Cliffs of Dover, this earliest-known name for Britain was used as far back as 300 B.C.

(2, 4).clue: A rainbow is a spectrum arranged by this, with red's the longest

(4, 4).clue: An excessively intense enthusiasm, in a person or a group

(5, 4).clue: Mell Lazarus, who passed away in 2016, created "Momma" & this other comic strip about a teacher with a fruit name

(6, 4).clue: Abbreviated C.O.L.A., it's a wage increase to help workers keep up with rising prices

(1, 5).clue: Dying childless in 1714 despite 18 pregnancies, Queen Anne was this dynasty's last monarch

(2, 5).clue: The ring is called a solar halo, and the two bright images on the side get this canine term when light passes through icy clouds

(3, 5).clue: A Nobel Prize ceremony in Stockholm

(4, 5).clue: An unfettered wide view in all directions

(5, 5).clue: "Lazarus Laughed", a 1928 play by this Pulitzer winner, was preceded by his similar "The Great God Brown"

(6, 5).clue: As an adjective it means caused by heat; as a noun it means a rising current of warm air used by hang gliders

(0, 0).clue: The 1st scene in this book: "With the brass nozzle in his fists, with this great python spitting its venomous kerosene"
